body:
<!-- This form is for bug reports and feature requests ONLY!

If you're looking for help check [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/kubernetes) and the [troubleshooting guide](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/debug-application-cluster/troubleshooting/).

If the matter is security related, please disclose it privately via https://kubernetes.io/security/.
-->

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

/kind bug

/sig testing

**What happened**:

The tests under ``test/e2e/autoscaling/cluster_size_autoscaling.go`` will run only for the ``gce, gke`` providers, which is checked in ``BeforeEach``[1]. But during ``AfterEach``, it will wrongfully wait for the number ready nodes to "return" to the original ``expectedNumber``, which is set to 0, as ``originalSizes`` is empty. The wait time is 20 minutes. This can be seen from the logs[2]. 

[1] https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/73790b8f6d9e878c13401b7139d0221b5a9698d6/test/e2e/autoscaling/cluster_size_autoscaling.go#L98
[2] https://paste.ubuntu.com/p/5YmkSJT3vk/

**What you expected to happen**:

The tests should just be skipped entirely if the provider is not ``gce, gke``, not just the ``BeforeEach`` step. 

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:

Run the ``cluster_size_autoscaling.go`` tests with any provider other than ``gce, gke``.

**Anything else we need to know?**:

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): Kubernetes v1.11.1
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration: Local
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): N/A
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): N/A
- Install tools: N/A
- Others: N/A

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Testing.
labels.name: sig/testing

title: cluster_size_autoscaling shouldn't wait for restoring the initial cluster size if the provider is not supported
